metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14760 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Optimizer). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.31 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server as well as unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.5 (Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:H).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.32-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.32-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.32-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.32-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.32-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.32-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.32-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.32-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.32-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.32-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored. mdeslaur> 5.7 only

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.32-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
